original_title: Mark Your Calendars, NASA is Holding a Public Meeting on UFOs
original_content:
Were sorry, the politically correct term these days is unidentified anomalous phenomena (UAP), as its less likely to excite those with a predilection for tinfoil hats. But whether you call them flying objects or anomalous phenomena, its that unidentified part that has us interested.
Which is why well be tuned into NASA TV at 10:30 a.m. EDT on May 31  thats when the agency has announced theyll be broadcasting a meeting of an independent study team tasked with categorizing and evaluating UAP data. The public can even submit their own questions, the most popular of which will be passed on to the team.
Before you get too excited, the meeting is about how NASA can evaluate and study UAP by using data, technology, and the tools of science, and the press release explains that they wont be reviewing or assessing any unidentifiable observations. So if youre hoping for the US governments tacit acknowledgment that were not alone in the universe, youll probably be disappointed. That said, they wouldnt have to assemble a team to study these reports if they were all so easily dismissed. As always, interstellar visitors are dead last on the list of possible explanations, but some cases have too much hard evidence to be dismissed out of hand. They might not be little green men, but they are something.
More after the break.

Declassified videos show US military aircraft encountering UAPs
Those with an interest in such things are likely already aware of the 2022 Annual Report on Unidentified Aerial Phenomena released by the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI). The report explains that under the direction of the Secretary of Defense, an All-Domain Anomaly Resolution Office (AARO) had been established in July of 2022 to catalog and analyze credible UAP cases. The paper further reveals that of the 366 cases the AARO was actively investigating, only 195 could be deemed unremarkable and likely the result of a drone, balloon, or wildlife.
Does that mean the remaining 171 were the product of interdimensional incursions? Of course not. But the report does acknowledge that some of these uncharacterized UAP appear to have demonstrated unusual flight characteristics or performance capabilities which makes their identification difficult. The reports recommendation was simple enough: in order to collect more data, UAP cases needed to be taken more seriously.
This NASA meeting is a step towards that goal, and were looking forward to seeing the teams final recommendations when theyre released over the summer. The truth is out there.
title: 「未特定の異常現象」の研究についてNASAが報告
body: NASAが、未確認異常現象（UAP）に関する独立した調査チームの会議を5月31日に放送すると発表した。公衆は自分達の質問を提出できるが、会議はデータ、技術、科学の道具を使用してUAPを評価するかとのこと。政府による宇宙人の存在の暗示は期待できないが、独自の飛行能力を示すものがあるため調査チームが組織された可能性があることを示唆している。ODNIの報告書もUAPを重要視するよう提案している。
titles: 「未特定の異常現象」の研究についてNASAが報告
NASAが独立研究チームを結成し「未特定の異常現象（UAP）」について調査開始
パイロットによって撮影された「未特定の異常現象（UAP）」映像を米軍が解放
「未特定の異常現象（UAP）」に興味がある人には、米国の国家情報長官が公表した報告書を紹介
NASAが「未特定の異常現象（UAP）」による飛行機衝突事故の抑制を目的とした研究チームを結成
